instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> clean me region
threads.message:
Hi Team,
I have a mba that loads the os very slowly and then get stuck at 100%, it had water damage around the <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> area.
the mba has already been touch by some else apparently: a trace was rebuilt and the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip replaced: i took it out and read it with the TL866 and the serial numbers in the chip and on the back cover are NOT the same.
Do you know where i can get a clean efi bin file for an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, like in that topic at the 2nd page:
[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/11949-macbook-air-2015-board-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-problem-with-loading-osx-after-efi-reprogramed/page2[/url]

Speedyaction is the owner of the file, i've alerady tried to contact him by PM and through the forum topic but so far i had no reply from him.

I would like to rebuilt a good bios file with the correct serial number, i've read that for the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> it's not like the previous models regarding the ME region like it's explained in the ghostlyhaks tutorial, in fact in the820-00165 bios files i have i can't find any "KRID" .
So maybe if you could also explain how to generate a clean ME region.

Thanks
